summary: Build a website for KMI Fellowship of Churches (and Elohim’s International Revival Center) using the provided brand color palette, including core church information, ministries, outreach, leadership/governance details, an appointment scheduling request form (Wix Forms structure), and a dedicated “The Gathering at 6” service page/section.
architectural_notes: Target platform implied: Wix (use Wix Forms for appointment scheduling).
Use provided brand palette/usage guide: Gold #D4AF37, Deep Blue #0E2A47, Orange #E25822, Purple #5B2C83, Brown #6B4F2D, Neutral #F5F1E8; text #1C1C1C/#5F5F5F; white on dark.
Appointment scheduling implemented as a request workflow (submit → review/confirm), not instant booking.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Abstract church hero banner with warm light neutral background, deep midnight blue overlays, subtle gold accents and flame-inspired shapes (kmi-hero.dim_1920x800.png)
- Minimal emblem-style logo mark featuring a cross/flame motif in gold and deep blue on transparent background (kmi-mark.dim_512x512.png)

existing_features.title: Create a multi-page church website for “KMI Fellowship of Churches” (including references to “Elohim’s International Revival Center” where provided) with clear navigation and sections/pages for: Home/Welcome, Who We Are, Our Mission, What to Expect When You Visit, Our Ministries, Community Outreach, Connect With Us (including placeholders for service times, location/contact details, live stream/sermons link, and social media links).

Add a dedicated page/section for “The Gathering at 6” that includes: title/subtitle, launch date (February 22), recurrence (every second & fourth Sunday), time (6:00 PM), location (13704 NW 150th Place, Alachua, Florida 32616, right next to Alachua Elementary School), and the provided “What to Expect” bullet list.

Add a Leadership & Governance page/section containing: Presiding Prelate bio header and summary for Dr. Virgil Leo Postell Jr.; Apostolic & Ministerial Governance Structure including Joint Colleges list (Apostles, Prophets, Evangelists, Pastors, Bishops vacant), Schools of Ministry list (Teachers, Ministers), Councils & Assemblies list (Deacons & Deaconesses, Board of Ruling Elders, Joint College of Armor Bearers), Episcopal Positions note (bishops vacant until appointed), Tribunal & Tribunal of Wisdom description, and the Accountability & Legal Compliance statement.

Implement a “Schedule a Meeting with Leadership” appointment request form matching the provided field structure: Full Name (required), Email Address (required), Phone Number (required), Church/Organization (optional), Request Type dropdown with the exact options provided, “Leader You Are Requesting to Meet With” text box, Preferred Date (date picker), Preferred Time (time picker), Urgency Level (Routine/Time-Sensitive/Emergency), Details of Request (large text box), and Consent/Acknowledgement checkbox with the provided label; include form validation and a clear submission success state.

Add a “Chief Apostle & Prophet Availability” section on the Leadership page that shows an availability calendar/status legend with the three states (Available, Out of Office, Limited Availability) and includes the note that submitting a request does not guarantee an appointment until confirmation is received.

Apply the provided brand color palette and UI usage guide consistently across the site: header/nav background and text, footer styling, link colors and hover states, primary/secondary buttons and hover states, and special sections including scripture/quote blocks and event highlights.

Establish a cohesive visual theme (layout, typography pairing, spacing system, and section styling) appropriate for a modern church website, using warm neutrals and the provided royal gold/deep blue/orange/purple palette; ensure consistency across all pages.

Add primary calls-to-action in appropriate locations (e.g., header and Home page) that route to key pages: “Plan Your Visit” (routes to the “What to Expect When You Visit” content), “Watch Live” (placeholder link area on Connect page/section), and “Schedule a Meeting” (routes to the appointment request form).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create core website content/pages for KMI Fellowship of Churches (Home/Welcome, Who We Are, Mission, What to Expect, Ministries, Community Outreach, Connect/Contact).
Add a dedicated page/section for “The Gathering at 6” evening worship service including schedule, location, and launch date details.
Add Leadership & Governance page/section describing presiding prelate, governance structure (joint colleges, schools, councils/assemblies), tribunal details, and compliance statement.
Implement “Schedule a Meeting with Leadership” appointment request form using the specified Wix Forms required fields, dropdown options, date/time pickers, urgency, details, and consent checkbox.
Add a leadership availability calendar/status legend section for Chief Apostle & Prophet (Available/Out of Office/Limited) with note that submission doesn’t guarantee confirmation.
Apply the provided brand color palette and UI usage guide across the site (buttons, links, header/nav, footer, special sections).
